qas.question: What kind of infringement resulted from sharing MP3s?
What name did the record companies associate with MP3 file sharing?
Who was the target of the record companies?

context: The ease of creating and sharing MP3s resulted in widespread <a0_0>copyright<a0_0/> infringement. Major record companies argued that this free sharing of music reduced sales, and called it "<a1_0>music piracy<a1_0/>". They reacted by pursuing lawsuits against <a2_0>Napster<a2_0/> (which was eventually <a3_0>shut down and later sold<a3_0/>) and against individual users who engaged in file sharing.
